JobFullDesc: Foods people love. Brands people trust. And a career that nourishes your future like no other.  At Nestlé USA, we are committed to providing high quality products that are essential to living well. As individuals and teams, we are empowered to make meaningful contributions that positively impact our families, communities, and planet. With our portfolio of global brands, the opportunities to innovate and grow are limitless. As the world's leading food and beverage company, our focus is not only about delighting our customers, it's about enriching you!  Position SummaryResponsible for the efficient, effective, and flawless execution of Innovation & Renovation (I&R) projects and I&R process improvement initiatives. May also include consumer complaint and productivity projects. Primary Responsibilities: Project Management- Apply project management tools and skills to ensure the on-time launch and flawless execution of projects from concept to close.- Leading the alignment of the strategy and approach for initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing the project with key stakeholders.- Leading the definition and communication of project scope, objectives and expectations.- Identifying project resource requirements and escalating resource constraints.- Building and managing the project schedule, defining the critical path, tracking activities to ensure functional team members are meeting agreed upon deadlines, generating and communicating status reports, and escalating critical issues.- Preventive management of roadblocks and generation of risk mitigation plans.- Coordinating and facilitating project meetings including kick-off meetings, project team meetings, risk assessments, lessons learned, post launch reviews and additional meetings as required.- Providing transparency and communication on project status and risks to cross functional team members, Project Management Lead and business Leadership Team. Process Management:Responsible for the consistent application, disciplined execution, and continuous improvement of Nestlé's I&R processes and tools including:- Managing projects and their cross-functional teams through the established processes, including the stage gate process.- Identifying, documenting and ensuring implementation of process improvements- Driving proper and consistent use of the stage gate project management tool by: maintaining and ensuring data accuracy, deliverable completion, and documentation as specified by relevant policies and procedures; and continuous improvement through maintenance of templates and supporting documentation- Meeting established critical metrics Qualifications: Requirements & Minimum Education Level•    Minimum BA/BS required•    PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification a plus Experience•    5 years of cross functional experience including but not limited to Engineering, Operations, Technical Applications Group, Research & Development, Marketing with 1-3 years of effective project management or related experience preferred•    Experience with stage gate methodology preferred•    Prior CPG experience preferred Additional Knowledge, Skills & Abilities•    Project management and project management software skills•    Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently is necessary•    Highly organized with strong time-management skills•    Ability to manage conflict and drive resolution•    Flexibility and adaptability to perform in a high-volume, fast paced and dynamic environment•    Focused on results, proactive, service oriented•    Ability to drive for results through effective leadership and coaching skills•    Ability to identify links between facts, ideas and situations that have no obvious connection•    Change management skills•    Excellent oral and written communication skills The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment.
